page.title: 11Pheasant Shooting in Sussex
page.content: Shoots are organised in Eridge Old Park for the shooting of pheasants, partridge and duck.Many of the pheasants are raised by the game keeper near Sham Farm.They are incubated from eggs and kept in runs until they are old enough to be let loose in the wood.The keeper continues to feed them until they are quite mature. When the shooting season begins, local people are hired to act as beaters.Shoots are organised for small parties,sometimes American visitors. The guests attending the shoot are well entertained with a special picnic lunch to accompany the days shooting.
